alert.note: Alert for Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 29 at 5:18AM EDT until July 29 at 2:39PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... The North Fork of the Kentucky River at Whitesburg, affecting Letcher County. ...A FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is likely still occurring. * WHERE...The Flood Warning is for the North Fork of the Kentucky River at Whitesburg. * WHEN...The Flood Warning is in effect until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, businesses begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The river level reached as high as 20.9 feet on Thursday morning. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - The previous highest crest reported was 14.7 feet on 01/29/1957. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by noon.
